cards.name: Bulbasaur
cards.text: A strange seed was planted on its back at birth. The plant sprouts and grows with this Pokémon.

cards.name: Ivysaur
cards.text: There is a plant bulb on its back. When it absorbs nutrients, the bulb is said to blossom into a large flower.

attacks.name: Toxic Whip
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused and Poisoned.

cards.name: Venusaur

abilities.name: Jungle Totem
abilities.text: Each basic Grass Energy attached to your Pokémon provides GrassGrass Energy. You can't apply more than 1 Jungle Totem Ability at a time.

cards.text: By spreading the broad petals of its flower and catching the sun's rays, it fills its body with power.

cards.name: Shroomish
cards.text: It prefers damp places. By day it remains still in the forest shade. It releases toxic powder from its head.

attacks.name: Absorb
attacks.text: Heal 20 damage from this Pokémon.

cards.name: Breloom
cards.text: Its short arms stretch when it throws punches. Its technique is equal to that of pro boxers.

attacks.name: Hibernation Spore
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep. Your opponent flips 2 coins instead of 1 between turns. If either of them is tails, that Pokémon is still Asleep.

cards.name: Carnivine
cards.text: It attracts prey with its sweet-smelling saliva, then chomps down. It takes a whole day to eat prey.

attacks.name: Flick Poison
attacks.text: Switch 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon with their Active Pokémon. The new Active Pokémon is now Poisoned.

attacks.name: Crunch
attacks.text: Discard an Energy from your opponent's Active Pokémon.

cards.name: Shaymin
cards.text: It can dissolve toxins in the air to instantly transform ruined land into a lush field of flowers.

attacks.name: Flippity Flap
attacks.text: Shuffle your hand into your deck. Then, draw 6 cards.

attacks.name: Rally Back
attacks.text: If any of your Pokémon were Knocked Out by damage from an opponent's attack during their last turn, this attack does 90 more damage.

cards.name: Virizion
cards.text: Its head sprouts horns as sharp as blades. Using whirlwind-like movements, it confounds and swiftly cuts opponents.

attacks.name: Wrapped in Wind
attacks.text: You may attach a basic Energy card from your hand to this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Pike
attacks.text: This attack does 30 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

cards.name: Shining Genesect

abilities.name: Energy Reload
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may move a Grass Energy from 1 of your other Pokémon to this Pokémon.

cards.text: This ancient bug Pokémon was altered by Team Plasma. They upgraded the cannon on its back.

attacks.name: Gaia Blaster
attacks.text: This attack does 20 more damage times the amount of Grass Energy attached to this Pokémon.

cards.name: Entei-GX
cards.text: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Fire Fang
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Burned.

attacks.name: Brave Burn-GX
attacks.text: This attack does 150 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.) (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

cards.name: Entei-GX
cards.text: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Fire Fang
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Burned.

attacks.name: Brave Burn-GX
attacks.text: This attack does 150 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.) (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

cards.name: Torkoal
cards.text: Coal is the source of Torkoal's energy. Large amounts of coal can be found in the mountains where they live.

attacks.name: High-Pressure Heat
attacks.text: During your next turn, this Pokémon's High-Pressure Heat attack does 50 more damage (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Flamethrower
attacks.text: Discard an Energy from this Pokémon.

cards.name: Larvesta
cards.text: Said to have been born from the sun, it spews fire from its horns and encases itself in a cocoon of fire when it evolves.

cards.name: Volcarona

abilities.name: Heat Cyclone
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may have your opponent switch their Active Pokémon with 1 of their Benched Pokémon.

cards.text: A sea of fire engulfs the surroundings of their battles, since they use their six wings to scatter their ember scales.

cards.name: Reshiram
cards.text: This legendary Pokémon can scorch the world with fire. It helps those who want to build a world of truth.

attacks.name: Outrage
attacks.text: This attack does 10 more damage for each damage counter on this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Scorching Breath
attacks.text: This Pokémon can't attack during your next turn.

cards.name: Litten
cards.text: While grooming itself, it builds up fur inside its stomach. It sets the fur alight and spews fiery attacks, which change based on how it coughs.

cards.name: Torracat
cards.text: At its throat, it bears a bell of fire. The bell rings brightly whenever this Pokémon spits fire.

attacks.name: Swagger
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, discard an Energy from your opponent's Active Pokémon.

cards.name: Incineroar
cards.text: This Pokémon has a violent, selfish disposition. If it's not in the mood to listen, it will ignore its Trainer's orders with complete nonchalance.

attacks.name: Profane Punch
attacks.text: If your Benched Pokémon have any damage counters on them, this attack does 80 more damage.

attacks.name: Flare Blitz
attacks.text: Discard all Fire Energy from this Pokémon.

cards.name: Totodile
cards.text: It is small but rough and tough. It won't hesitate to take a bite out of anything that moves.

cards.name: Croconaw

abilities.name: Plunge
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if this Pokémon is on your Bench, you may move all Energy from your Active Pokémon to this Pokémon. If you do, switch it with your Active Pokémon.

cards.text: If it loses a fang, a new one grows back in its place. There are always 48 fangs lining its mouth.

cards.name: Feraligatr
cards.text: It usually moves slowly, but it goes at blinding speed when it attacks and bites prey.

attacks.name: Crunch
attacks.text: Discard an Energy from your opponent's Active Pokémon.

cards.name: Qwilfish
cards.text: To fire its poison spikes, it must inflate its body by drinking over 2.6 gallons of water all at once.

attacks.name: Poison Sting
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned.

attacks.name: Shocking Sting
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon is affected by a Special Condition, this attack does 50 more damage.

cards.name: Buizel
cards.text: It swims by rotating its two tails like a screw. When it dives, its flotation sac collapses.

cards.name: Floatzel
cards.text: It floats using its well-developed flotation sac. It assists in the rescues of drowning people.

attacks.name: Aqua Bomb
attacks.text: This Pokémon does 30 damage to itself.

cards.name: Palkia
cards.text: It is said to live in a gap in the spatial dimension parallel to ours. It appears in mythology.

attacks.name: Spiral Drain
attacks.text: Heal 30 damage from this Pokémon.

cards.name: Manaphy

abilities.name: Blessings of the Deep
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may heal 20 damage from 1 of your Pokémon that has any Water Energy attached to it.

cards.text: It is born with a wondrous power that lets it bond with any kind of Pokémon.

cards.name: Keldeo
cards.text: It crosses the world, running over the surfaces of oceans and rivers. It appears at scenic waterfronts.

attacks.name: Bail Out
attacks.text: Put a Water Pokémon from your discard pile into your hand.

attacks.name: Resolute Blade
attacks.text: This attack does 20 more damage for each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon.

cards.name: Shining Volcanion
cards.text: It lets out billows of steam and disappears into the dense fog. It's said to live in mountains where humans do not tread.

attacks.name: Dual Pump
attacks.text: This attack does 50 damage to 2 of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Quad Smash
attacks.text: Flip 4 coins. This attack does 50 damage for each heads.

cards.name: Pikachu
cards.text: A plan was recently announced to gather many Pikachu and make an electric power plant.

attacks.name: Iron Tail
attacks.text: Flip a coin until you get tails. This attack does 20 damage for each heads.

cards.name: Raichu-GX
cards.text: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Powerful Spark
attacks.text: This attack does 20 more damage times the amount of Lightning Energy attached to your Pokémon.

attacks.name: Thunder
attacks.text: This Pokémon does 30 damage to itself.

attacks.name: Voltail-GX
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

cards.name: Voltorb
cards.text: It was discovered when Poké Balls were introduced. It is said that there is some connection.

cards.name: Electrode
cards.text: It explodes in response to even minor stimuli. It is feared, with the nickname of "The Bomb Ball."

attacks.name: Swift
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness, Resistance, or any other effects on your opponent's Active Pokémon.

cards.name: Raikou
cards.text: The rain clouds it carries let it fire thunderbolts at will. They say that it descended with lightning.

attacks.name: Booming Thunder
attacks.text: Attach a Lightning Energy card from your discard pile to 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

cards.name: Plusle
cards.text: It cheers on friends with pom-poms made of sparks. It drains power from telephone poles.

attacks.name: Tag Team Boost
attacks.text: If Minun is on your Bench, this attack does 50 more damage.

cards.name: Minun
cards.text: Exposure to electricity from Minun and Plusle promotes blood circulation and relaxes muscles.

attacks.name: Collect
attacks.text: Draw a card.

attacks.name: Spark
attacks.text: This attack does 20 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

cards.name: Zekrom
cards.text: This legendary Pokémon can scorch the world with lightning. It assists those who want to build an ideal world.

attacks.name: Outrage
attacks.text: This attack does 10 more damage for each damage counter on this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Storm Blade
attacks.text: Discard 2 Energy from this Pokémon.

cards.name: Ekans
cards.text: The older it gets, the longer it grows. At night, it wraps its long body around tree branches to rest.

attacks.name: Poison Sting
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned.

cards.name: Arbok

abilities.name: Intimidating Pattern
abilities.text: As long as this Pokémon is your Active Pokémon, your opponent's Active Pokémon's attacks do 30 less damage (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

cards.text: The pattern on its belly appears to be a frightening face. Weak foes will flee just at the sight of the pattern.

attacks.name: Venomous Fang
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned.

cards.name: Jynx
cards.text: It wiggles its hips as it walks. It can cause people to dance in unison with it.

attacks.name: Whiny Voice
attacks.text: Choose a random card from your opponent's hand. Your opponent reveals that card and shuffles it into their deck.

attacks.name: Feverish Kiss
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.

cards.name: Mewtwo-GX
cards.text: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Full Burst
attacks.text: This attack does 30 damage times the amount of Energy attached to this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Super Absorption
attacks.text: Heal 30 damage from this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Psystrike-GX
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by any effects on your opponent's Active Pokémon. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

cards.name: Shining Mew
cards.text: Because it can use all kinds of moves, many scientists believe Mew to be the ancestor of Pokémon.

attacks.name: Legendary Guidance
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 2 Energy cards and attach them to your Pokémon in any way you like. Then, shuffle your deck.

cards.name: Latios
cards.text: A highly intelligent Pokémon. By folding back its wings in flight, it can overtake jet planes.

attacks.name: Break Through
attacks.text: This attack does 30 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

cards.name: Shining Jirachi
cards.text: Generations have believed that any wish written on a note on its head will come true when it awakens.

attacks.name: Stellar Reign
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon is an evolved Pokémon, devolve it by putting all of the Evolution cards on it into your opponent's hand.

cards.name: Golett
cards.text: The energy that burns inside it enables it to move, but no one has yet been able to identify this energy.

cards.name: Golurk
cards.text: It is said that Golurk were ordered to protect people and Pokémon by the ancient people who made them.

attacks.name: Triple Smash
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 60 more damage for each heads.

cards.name: Marshadow

abilities.name: Let Loose
abilities.text: When you play this Pokémon from your hand onto your Bench during your turn, you may have each player shuffle their hand into their deck and draw 4 cards.

cards.text: Able to conceal itself in shadows, it never appears before humans, so its very existence was the stuff of myth.

attacks.name: Shadow Punch
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Resistance.

cards.name: Stunfisk
cards.text: Its skin is very hard, so it is unhurt even if stepped on by sumo wrestlers. It smiles when transmitting electricity.

attacks.name: Thunder Shock
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

cards.name: Spiritomb

abilities.name: Cursed Whirlpool
abilities.text: As long as this Pokémon is your Active Pokémon, your opponent's Active Pokémon can't retreat.

cards.text: A Pokémon that was formed by 108 spirits. It is bound to a fissure in an odd keystone.

attacks.name: Cursed Drop
attacks.text: Put 3 damage counters on your opponent's Pokémon in any way you like.

cards.name: Purrloin
cards.text: Its cute act is a ruse. When victims let down their guard, they find their items taken. It attacks with sharp claws.

attacks.name: Tail Rap
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 20 damage for each heads.

cards.name: Liepard
cards.text: Their beautiful form comes from the muscles they have developed. They run silently in the night.

attacks.name: Torment
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Active Pokémon's attacks. That Pokémon can't use that attack during your opponent's next turn.

cards.name: Scraggy
cards.text: Its skin has a rubbery elasticity, so it can reduce damage by defensively pulling its skin up to its neck.

attacks.name: Call for Family
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Basic Pokémon and put it onto your Bench. Then, shuffle your deck.

cards.name: Scrafty
cards.text: It pulls up its shed skin to protect itself while it kicks. The bigger the crest, the more respected it is.

attacks.name: Dangerous Head
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon is a Basic Pokémon, this attack does 50 more damage.

cards.name: Zorua
cards.text: It changes so it looks like its foe, tricks it, and then uses that opportunity to flee.

cards.name: Zoroark-GX

abilities.name: Trade
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may discard a card from your hand. If you do, draw 2 cards.

cards.text: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Riotous Beating
attacks.text: This attack does 20 damage for each of your Pokémon in play.

attacks.name: Trickster-GX
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon's attacks and use it as this attack. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

cards.name: Yveltal
cards.text: When this legendary Pokémon's wings and tail feathers spread wide and glow red, it absorbs the life force of living creatures.

attacks.name: Strafe
attacks.text: You may switch this Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Oblivion Wing
attacks.text: Attach a Darkness Energy card from your discard pile to 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

cards.name: Hoopa

abilities.name: Scoundrel Guard
abilities.text: Prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to this Pokémon by your opponent's Pokémon-GX or Pokémon-EX.

cards.text: In its true form, it possess a huge amount of power. Legends of its avarice tell how it once carried off an entire castle to gain the treasure hidden within.

cards.name: Shining Rayquaza
cards.text: It lives in the ozone layer far above the clouds and cannot be seen from the ground.

attacks.name: Dragon Pulse
attacks.text: Discard the top 2 cards of your deck.

attacks.name: Sky Judgment
attacks.text: Discard 3 Energy from this Pokémon.

cards.name: Shining Arceus

abilities.name: Fabled Defense
abilities.text: As long as this Pokémon is your Active Pokémon, prevent all damage done to your Benched Pokémon by your opponent's attacks.

cards.text: According to the legends of Sinnoh, this Pokémon emerged from an egg and shaped all there is in this world.

attacks.name: Ultimate Arrow
attacks.text: This attack does 30 damage to each of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

cards.name: Damage Mover
cards.text: Move 3 damage counters from 1 of your Pokémon to another of your Pokémon.,You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

cards.name: Energy Retrieval
cards.text: Put 2 basic Energy cards from your discard pile into your hand.,You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

cards.name: Great Ball
cards.text: Look at the top 7 cards of your deck. You may reveal a Pokémon you find there and put it into your hand. Shuffle the other cards back into your deck.,You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

cards.name: Hau
cards.text: Draw 3 cards.,You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

cards.name: Lillie
cards.text: Draw cards until you have 6 cards in your hand. If it's your first turn, draw cards until you have 8 cards in your hand.,You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

cards.name: Pokémon Breeder
cards.text: Draw 2 cards and heal 20 damage from your Active Pokémon. If you have no cards in your deck, you can't play this card.,You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

cards.name: Pokémon Catcher
cards.text: Flip a coin. If heads, switch 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon with their Active Pokémon.,You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

cards.name: Sophocles
cards.text: Discard 2 cards from your hand. If you do, draw 4 cards.,You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

cards.name: Super Scoop Up
cards.text: Flip a coin. If heads, put 1 of your Pokémon and all cards attached to it into your hand.,You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

cards.name: Switch
cards.text: Switch your Active Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.,You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

cards.name: Ultra Ball
cards.text: Discard 2 cards from your hand. If you do, search your deck for a Pokémon, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.,You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

cards.name: Ultra Ball
cards.text: Discard 2 cards from your hand. If you do, search your deck for a Pokémon, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.,You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

cards.name: Double Colorless Energy
cards.text: Double Colorless Energy provides ColorlessColorless Energy.

cards.name: Warp Energy
cards.text: This card provides Colorless Energy.,When you attach this card from your hand to your Active Pokémon, switch that Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

cards.name: Entei-GX
cards.text: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Fire Fang
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Burned.

attacks.name: Brave Burn-GX
attacks.text: This attack does 150 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.) (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)
